## Description {#details}

This file is a part of <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-dataflowsanitizer-cpp-/dataflowsanitizer">DataFlowSanitizer</a>, a generalised dynamic data flow analysis.

Unlike other Sanitizer tools, this tool is not designed to detect a specific class of bugs on its own. Instead, it provides a generic dynamic data flow analysis framework to be used by clients to help detect application-specific issues within their own code.

The analysis is based on automatic propagation of data flow labels (also known as taint labels) through a program as it performs computation.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/argument">Argument</a> and return value labels are passed through TLS variables &#95;&#95;dfsan&#95;arg&#95;tls and &#95;&#95;dfsan&#95;retval&#95;tls.

Each byte of application memory is backed by a shadow memory byte. The shadow byte can represent up to 8 labels. On Linux/x86&#95;64, memory is then laid out as follows:

+-----------------—+ 0x800000000000 (top of memory) | application 3 | +-----------------—+ 0x700000000000 | invalid | +-----------------—+ 0x610000000000 | origin 1 | +-----------------—+ 0x600000000000 | application 2 | +-----------------—+ 0x510000000000 | shadow 1 | +-----------------—+ 0x500000000000 | invalid | +-----------------—+ 0x400000000000 | origin 3 | +-----------------—+ 0x300000000000 | shadow 3 | +-----------------—+ 0x200000000000 | origin 2 | +-----------------—+ 0x110000000000 | invalid | +-----------------—+ 0x100000000000 | shadow 2 | +-----------------—+ 0x010000000000 | application 1 | +-----------------—+ 0x000000000000

MEM&#95;TO&#95;SHADOW(mem) = mem ^ 0x500000000000 SHADOW&#95;TO&#95;ORIGIN(shadow) = shadow + 0x100000000000

For more information, please refer to the design document: <a href="http://clang.llvm.org/docs/DataFlowSanitizerDesign.html">http://clang.llvm.org/docs/DataFlowSanitizerDesign.html</a>

<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This file is a part of DataFlowSanitizer, a generalised dynamic data flow</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// analysis.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Unlike other Sanitizer tools, this tool is not designed to detect a specific</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// class of bugs on its own.  Instead, it provides a generic dynamic data flow</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// analysis framework to be used by clients to help detect application-specific</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// issues within their own code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The analysis is based on automatic propagation of data flow labels (also</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// known as taint labels) through a program as it performs computation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Argument and return value labels are passed through TLS variables</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#95;&#95;dfsan&#95;arg&#95;tls and &#95;&#95;dfsan&#95;retval&#95;tls.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Each byte of application memory is backed by a shadow memory byte. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// shadow byte can represent up to 8 labels. On Linux/x86&#95;64, memory is then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// laid out as follows:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 140737488355328 (top of memory)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |    application 3   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 123145302310912</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |      invalid       |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 106652627894272</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |      origin 1      |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 105553116266496</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |    application 2   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 89060441849856</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |      shadow 1      |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 87960930222080</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |      invalid       |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 70368744177664</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |      origin 3      |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 52776558133248</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |      shadow 3      |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 35184372088832</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |      origin 2      |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 18691697672192</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |      invalid       |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 17592186044416</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |      shadow 2      |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 1099511627776</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// |    application 1   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// +--------------------+ 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// MEM&#95;TO&#95;SHADOW(mem) = mem ^ 87960930222080</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SHADOW&#95;TO&#95;ORIGIN(shadow) = shadow + 17592186044416</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For more information, please refer to the design document:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The -dfsan-preserve-alignment flag controls whether this pass assumes that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// alignment requirements provided by the input IR are correct.  For example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if the input IR contains a load with alignment 8, this flag will cause</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the shadow load to have alignment 16  This flag is disabled by default as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we have unfortunately encountered too much code (including Clang itself;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// see PR14291) which performs misaligned access.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138" lineLink="#a5f58d18a4fdfd2fda2d3f931f869e2a1"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;bool&gt;</a> <a href="#a5f58d18a4fdfd2fda2d3f931f869e2a1">ClPreserveAlignment</a>(</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The ABI list files control how shadow parameters are passed. The pass treats</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// every function labelled &quot;uninstrumented&quot; in the ABI list file as conforming</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to the &quot;native&quot; (i.e. unsanitized) ABI.  Unless the ABI list contains</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// additional annotations for those functions, a call to one of those functions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// will produce a warning message, as the labelling behaviour of the function is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// unknown. The other supported annotations for uninstrumented functions are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &quot;functional&quot; and &quot;discard&quot;, which are described below under</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// DataFlowSanitizer::WrapperKind.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Functions will often be labelled with both &quot;uninstrumented&quot; and one of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &quot;functional&quot; or &quot;discard&quot;. This will leave the function unchanged by this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pass, and create a wrapper function that will call the original.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Instrumented functions can also be annotated as &quot;force&#95;zero&#95;labels&quot;, which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// will make all shadow and return values set zero labels.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Functions should never be labelled with both &quot;force&#95;zero&#95;labels&quot; and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &quot;uninstrumented&quot; or any of the unistrumented wrapper kinds.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159" lineLink="#a512552844843860182e5376df0ff2e15"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/list">cl::list&lt;std::string&gt;</a> <a href="#a512552844843860182e5376df0ff2e15">ClABIListFiles</a>(</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Memory map parameters used in application-to-shadow address calculation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Offset = (Addr &amp; ~AndMask) ^ XorMask</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Transforming a function may change the position of arguments.  This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// member records the mapping from each argument&#39;s old position to its new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// position.  Argument positions are zero-indexed.  If the transformation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// from F to F&#39; made the first argument of F into the third argument of F&#39;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// then ArgumentIndexMapping&#91;0&#93; will equal 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-dataflowsanitizer-cpp-/transformedfunction/#a7ee9b90c50e4cab5497133418264f68c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;unsigned&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-dataflowsanitizer-cpp-/transformedfunction/#a7ee9b90c50e4cab5497133418264f68c">ArgumentIndexMapping</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// How should calls to uninstrumented functions be handled?</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> WrapperKind &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This function is present in an uninstrumented form but we don&#39;t know</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// how it should be handled.  Print a warning and call the function anyway.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Don&#39;t label the return value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlight">    WK&#95;Warning,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This function does not write to (user-accessible) memory, and its return</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// value is unlabelled.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlight">    WK&#95;Discard,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This function does not write to (user-accessible) memory, and the label</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// of its return value is the union of the label of its arguments.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlight">    WK&#95;Functional,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Instead of calling the function, a custom wrapper &#95;&#95;dfsw&#95;F is called,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// where F is the name of the function.  This function may wrap the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// original function or provide its own implementation. WK&#95;Custom uses an</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><span class="doxyHighlight">    WK&#95;Custom</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1286"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The original code before calling this wrapper may have checked for null,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1287"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but replacing with a known-to-not-be-null wrapper can break this check.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1288"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When replacing uses of the extern weak function with the wrapper we try</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1289"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to avoid replacing uses in conditionals, but this is not perfect.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1290"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In the case where we fail, and accidentally optimize out a null check</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1291"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for a extern weak function, add a check here to help identify the issue.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1292"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a25e8e3490a28e9178b302b76ae643443">GlobalValue::isExternalWeakLinkage</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>-&gt;getLinkage())) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1628"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Extern weak functions can sometimes be null at execution time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1629"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Code will sometimes check if an extern weak function is null.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1630"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This could look something like:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1631"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   declare extern&#95;weak i8 @my&#95;func(i8)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1632"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   br i1 icmp ne (i8 (i8)&#42; @my&#95;func, i8 (i8)&#42; null), label %use&#95;my&#95;func,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1633"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   label %avoid&#95;my&#95;func</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1634"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The @&quot;dfsw$my&#95;func&quot; wrapper is never null, so if we replace this use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1635"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the comparison, the icmp will simplify to false and we have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1636"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// accidentally optimized away a null check that is necessary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1637"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This can lead to a crash when the null extern&#95;weak my&#95;func is called.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1638"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1639"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To prevent (the most common pattern of) this problem,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1640"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// do not replace uses in comparisons with the wrapper.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1641"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We definitely want to replace uses in call instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1642"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Other uses (e.g. store the function address somewhere) might be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1643"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// called or compared or both - this case may not be handled correctly.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1644"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We will default to replacing with wrapper in cases we are unsure.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1645"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IsNotCmpUse = &#91;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> &amp;U) -&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1646"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a> &#42;Usr = U.getUser();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1647"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantexpr">ConstantExpr</a> &#42;CE = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;ConstantExpr&gt;</a>(Usr)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1648"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is the most common case for icmp ne null</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1649"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (CE-&gt;getOpcode() == Instruction::ICmp) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2122"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> != 0);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2123"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; if Size == 1, it is sufficient to load its origin aligned at 4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2124"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; if Size == 2, we assume most cases Addr % 2 == 0, so it is sufficient to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2125"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   load its origin aligned at 4 If not, although origins may be lost, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2126"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   should not happen very often.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2127"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; if align &gt;= 4, Addr must be aligned to 4, otherwise it is UB. When</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2128"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Size % 4 == 0, it is more efficient to load origins without callbacks.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2129"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; Otherwise we use &#95;&#95;dfsan&#95;load&#95;label&#95;and&#95;origin.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2130"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This should ensure that common cases run efficiently.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2131"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> &lt;= 2)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2132"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2133"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2134"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad4b2e7a84faf3d7b6ffb84b541358e00">llvm::assumeAligned</a>(InstAlignment.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align/#a80735739b49cf97a491922c8f9af2cc1">value</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2135"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Alignment &lt; <a href="#a3d392a14b38e5ca75d7cb0390bd7fc43">MinOriginAlignment</a> || !DFS.hasLoadSizeForFastPath(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2136"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2137"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2138"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;DataFlowSanitizer::loadNextOrigin(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> Pos,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2139"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                         <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> OriginAlign,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2140"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;&#42;OriginAddr) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder&lt;&gt;</a> IRB(Pos-&gt;getParent(), Pos);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2142"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#42;OriginAddr =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2143"><span class="doxyHighlight">      IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a73e0482b96d9d0cdfcc90c0a34f5b0db">CreateGEP</a>(OriginTy, &#42;OriginAddr, ConstantInt::get(IntptrTy, 1));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2144"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a3313ae2d314fb689cebdaf062d86eec5">CreateAlignedLoad</a>(OriginTy, &#42;OriginAddr, OriginAlign);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2145"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2146"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2147"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::pair&lt;Value &#42;, Value &#42;&gt; DFSanFunction::loadShadowFast(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2148"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;ShadowAddr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;OriginAddr, uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> ShadowAlign,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2149"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> OriginAlign, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;FirstOrigin, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> Pos) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2150"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ShouldTrackOrigins = DFS.shouldTrackOrigins();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2151"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> uint64&#95;t ShadowSize = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> &#42; DFS.ShadowWidthBytes;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2152"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2153"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> &gt;= 4 &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Not large enough load size for fast path!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2154"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2155"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Used for origin tracking.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2156"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;Value &#42;&gt; Shadows;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2157"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;Value &#42;&gt; Origins;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2158"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2159"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Load instructions in LLVM can have arbitrary byte sizes (e.g., 3, 12, 20)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2160"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but this function is only used in a subset of cases that make it possible</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2161"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to optimize the instrumentation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2162"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2163"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Specifically, when the shadow size in bytes (i.e., loaded bytes x shadow</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2164"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// per byte) is either:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2165"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - a multiple of 8  (common)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2166"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - equal to 4       (only for load32)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2167"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2168"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For the second case, we can fit the wide shadow in a 32-bit integer. In all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2169"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// other cases, we use a 64-bit integer to hold the wide shadow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2170"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;WideShadowTy =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2171"><span class="doxyHighlight">      ShadowSize == 4 ? <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a30dd396c5b40cd86c1591872e574ccdf">Type::getInt32Ty</a>(&#42;DFS.Ctx) : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a>::getInt64Ty(&#42;DFS.Ctx);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2172"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2173"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder&lt;&gt;</a> IRB(Pos-&gt;getParent(), Pos);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2174"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;CombinedWideShadow =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2175"><span class="doxyHighlight">      IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a3313ae2d314fb689cebdaf062d86eec5">CreateAlignedLoad</a>(WideShadowTy, ShadowAddr, ShadowAlign);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2176"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2177"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> WideShadowBitWidth = WideShadowTy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a13e877ef779ba7a0688081079f4f9b03">getIntegerBitWidth</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2178"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> uint64&#95;t BytesPerWideShadow = WideShadowBitWidth / DFS.ShadowWidthBits;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2179"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2180"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AppendWideShadowAndOrigin = &#91;&amp;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;WideShadow, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;Origin) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2181"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (BytesPerWideShadow &gt; 4) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2182"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(BytesPerWideShadow == 8);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2183"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The wide shadow relates to two origin pointers: one for the first four</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2184"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// application bytes, and one for the latest four. We use a left shift to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2185"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// get just the shadow bytes that correspond to the first origin pointer,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2186"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and then the entire shadow for the second origin pointer (which will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2187"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// chosen by combineOrigins() iff the least-significant half of the wide</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2188"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// shadow was empty but the other half was not).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2189"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;WideShadowLo = IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a9b6a3be6451cf6a789d9305d90751c40">CreateShl</a>(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2190"><span class="doxyHighlight">          WideShadow, ConstantInt::get(WideShadowTy, WideShadowBitWidth / 2));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2191"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Shadows.push&#95;back(WideShadow);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2192"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Origins.push&#95;back(DFS.loadNextOrigin(Pos, OriginAlign, &amp;OriginAddr));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2193"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2194"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Shadows.push&#95;back(WideShadowLo);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2195"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Origins.push&#95;back(Origin);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2196"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2197"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Shadows.push&#95;back(WideShadow);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2198"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Origins.push&#95;back(Origin);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2199"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2200"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2201"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2202"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (ShouldTrackOrigins)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2203"><span class="doxyHighlight">    AppendWideShadowAndOrigin(CombinedWideShadow, FirstOrigin);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2204"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2205"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// First OR all the WideShadows (i.e., 64bit or 32bit shadow chunks) linearly;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2206"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// then OR individual shadows within the combined WideShadow by binary ORing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2207"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is fewer instructions than ORing shadows individually, since it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2208"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// needs logN shift/or instructions (N being the bytes of the combined wide</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2209"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// shadow).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (uint64&#95;t ByteOfs = BytesPerWideShadow; ByteOfs &lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2211"><span class="doxyHighlight">       ByteOfs += BytesPerWideShadow) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2212"><span class="doxyHighlight">    ShadowAddr = IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a73e0482b96d9d0cdfcc90c0a34f5b0db">CreateGEP</a>(WideShadowTy, ShadowAddr,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2213"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               ConstantInt::get(DFS.IntptrTy, 1));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2214"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;NextWideShadow =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2215"><span class="doxyHighlight">        IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a3313ae2d314fb689cebdaf062d86eec5">CreateAlignedLoad</a>(WideShadowTy, ShadowAddr, ShadowAlign);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2216"><span class="doxyHighlight">    CombinedWideShadow = IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#ab61be8e3cf17e9848aeeeabacfa1b09a">CreateOr</a>(CombinedWideShadow, NextWideShadow);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2217"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (ShouldTrackOrigins) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2218"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;NextOrigin = DFS.loadNextOrigin(Pos, OriginAlign, &amp;OriginAddr);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2219"><span class="doxyHighlight">      AppendWideShadowAndOrigin(NextWideShadow, NextOrigin);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2220"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2221"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2222"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Width = WideShadowBitWidth / 2; Width &gt;= DFS.ShadowWidthBits;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2223"><span class="doxyHighlight">       Width &gt;&gt;= 1) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2224"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;ShrShadow = IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a5849d19e500f8c6713ec44889058f424">CreateLShr</a>(CombinedWideShadow, Width);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2225"><span class="doxyHighlight">    CombinedWideShadow = IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#ab61be8e3cf17e9848aeeeabacfa1b09a">CreateOr</a>(CombinedWideShadow, ShrShadow);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2226"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2227"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#ab5b4acb0f45af3f2308cad1468804f1e">CreateTrunc</a>(CombinedWideShadow, DFS.PrimitiveShadowTy),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2228"><span class="doxyHighlight">          ShouldTrackOrigins</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2229"><span class="doxyHighlight">              ? <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-dataflowsanitizer-cpp-/dfsanfunction/#a92dd8bdf6470ea49d360683ec825dd4a">combineOrigins</a>(Shadows, Origins, Pos,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2230"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantint/#a9ad53d2a00a6fb861b3a048c6592b742">ConstantInt::getSigned</a>(IRB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a64748b5a9f8d8dd4499f84312e2c1336">getInt64Ty</a>(), 0))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2231"><span class="doxyHighlight">              : DFS.ZeroOrigin&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2232"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2233"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2234"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::pair&lt;Value &#42;, Value &#42;&gt; DFSanFunction::loadShadowOriginSansLoadTracking(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2235"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;Addr, uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> InstAlignment, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> Pos) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2236"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ShouldTrackOrigins = DFS.shouldTrackOrigins();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2237"></CodeLine>
